metadata.Title: CVE-2015-3731 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
WebKit, as used in Apple iOS before 8.4.1 and Safari before 6.2.8, 7.x before 7.1.8, and 8.x before 8.0.8, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (memory corruption and application crash) via a crafted web site, a different vulnerability than other WebKit CVEs listed in APPLE-SA-2015-08-13-1 and APPLE-SA-2015-08-13-3.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3731` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-3.0 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu1
gir1.2-webkit-3.0 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu1
gir1.2-webkit2-3.0 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-1.0-0 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-3.0-0 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-3.0-bin - 2.4.10-0ubuntu1
libwebkit2gtk-3.0-25 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu1
libwebkitgtk-1.0-0 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu1
libwebkitgtk-1.0-common - 2.4.10-0ubuntu1
libwebkitgtk-3.0-0 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu1
libwebkitgtk-3.0-common - 2.4.10-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'no update available').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
webkitgtk package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.10-0ubuntu1').
